entry.title: Kyiv air quality is at unhealthy level.
entry.summary: Air quality index (AQI) reports early on March 19 that pollutant concentration in Kyiv air is currently 27.8 times above the WHO annual air quality guideline value. entry.title: Norway prepares to welcome up to 100,000 Ukrainian refugees.
entry.summary: Reuters, citing Prime Minister of Norway Jonas Gahr Støre, reported on March 18 that Norway expects around 30,000 Ukrainian refugees, but is preparing to accommodate up to 100,000. entry.title: Kadyrov says he’s near Kyiv.
entry.summary: A video published by Chechen TV channel Grozny on March 13 supposedly shows Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov speaking with Chechen fighters about an attack that they say took place near the Ukrainian capital. entry.title: Ukraine asks to withdraw over 300 peacekeepers from UN missions.
entry.summary: Ukraine has requested to withdraw its remaining uniformed personnel serving with five U.N. peacekeeping operations in Mali, Cyprus, Abyei, South Sudan and Kosovo. entry.title: CNN: Stalled 64-km-long Russian convoy near Kyiv largely dispersed.
entry.summary: Satellite images taken on March 10 show the Russian military convoy northwest of Kyiv has “largely dispersed and redeployed,” Maxar Technologies says. entry.title: Reuters: WHO says it advised Ukraine to destroy stored pathogens in health labs to prevent disease leaks.
entry.summary: The World Health Organization, concerned with Russia’s military advance in Ukraine, advised destroying “high-threat” pathogens stored in public health laboratories, the agency told Reuters on March 10. entry.title: IMF: Default no longer an “unlikely event” for Russia.
entry.summary: IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said that the IMF predicts a deep recession of the Russian economy.
